content.detailedDescription: Traveling eastbound going home on pinemont road cr 252 about a quarter of mile from highway 90 with a friend who is a veteran of special forces, after visiting with another friend. the area is rural that we were leaving coming into lake cities outer boundaries an orange sphere about the size of a softball flashed from one field to the other as it crossed the road in front of us maybe some 300 feet ahead, the velocity was faster then a bullet and it had an orange tinge to it, it traveled parallel to the ground at about headlight height on the car. we both looked to each other to confirm that we had both seen it, when we went to look at which way it went it was nowhere in sight. i asked what the hell was that and my buddy said nothing from this world, we got the heck out of there as it scared both of us a good deal.
content.summary: Fast softball sized sphere traveling horizonally

content.detailedDescription: I was outside hanging up the washing on my balcony. as i looked towards the tress i noticed a spherical object hovering? in front of the trees. it was pulsing in brightness. the object seemed to go from transparent to solid. it was very bright. no sound. it didn't seem to move laterally. just staying in one spot, the pulsing got faster and then the object disappeared. the object was about the size of a large inflatable beachball. it was observable for about 5mins. truly weird.
content.summary: Spherical object. pulsing in brightness. from transparent to solid,.The pulsing got faster and then the object disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Our son came into the house from the neighbor's bon-fire and said he saw 3 orange lites in the sky as he was coming home. my wife and i went outside in front of our house with our son and we saw the same 3 orange lites in a straight line approximately one mile apart moving from the north to the south just east of detroit metro airport. there was a broken cloud deck at approx. 3000-4000 ft. the lites were below the cloud deck when first observed. i first thought they were aircraft landing lites but they were not the normal color of aircraft landing lites. i went back into the house and got my binoculars and came back outside and looked at the lead lite with my binoculars. there were no aircraft marker or strobe lites flashing in the vicinity of the lead lite, likewise for the other two orange lites. i steadied my elbows on my son's truck roof as i observed the lead orange lite move further south. there was no sound of an aircraft engine. at about the one o'clock position the lead lite entered the cloud deck. the cloud deck slowly obscured the lite as it ascended into the cloud deck. the second and third brite orange lites followed the same path as the first into the cloud deck. no further observations of the lites were made. the moon shone in the southern sky behind the broken cloud deck. i waited about another 5 mins to see if the orange lites would reappear in the vicinty of the moon but they did not. we went back inside the house for the rest of the evening. we discussed what we had seen and noted that none of us had heard any aircraft engine sounds during the whole incident and there were no aircraft marker lites observed.
content.summary: A series of 3 brite orange lites moving in a straight line about 1 mile apart.

content.detailedDescription:
Between 2 and 3 pm on wednesday, 9-15-2010, deciding to do a brief meditation exercise on my deck, i set up a chair in the shade on the north side of my home (a small deltec house with all-around deck). i have a clear view from there of the blanca massif, 15 miles to the north, at about 330 true. this is also the view from my "office" (i'm retired)as i sit at the computer. it is a very clear, sunny day, and as it was quite warm (even at 8,500 feet) i was conscious of the house soffit providing shade at this spot. this permits me to know the time approximately.

as i have been retired to this house since the summer of 1999, and as my office has been at the same spot all this time, the nice view of the mountains is something absolutely well-known and routine to me. i have looked at exactly this spot no doubt more than thousands of times in these years.

but this time, to my immediate surprise, i notice quite clearly a sun-reflecting metallic sphere slightly to the right (east) and slightly up from blanca peak. (angle from sun to object to me, about 60 degrees.) i feel immediately that it is something i've never seen before and quite large because i have lately been paying close attention to the aircraft passing above me here, ordinary jets and military aircraft are quite common, but lately i have been paying attention to them. with my unaided 20-30 vision i can make out the different shapes quite well as they pass over at, say, 35,000 feet, about 5 miles above me. this metallic sphere was definitely larger than the largest jet aircraft i see, and it was at least 15 miles away (distance from here to blanca peak). it subtended an angle about one half to three quarters the length of an overhead jet liner. i felt that it was beyond the mountain some indefinite distance, but not far.

key fact: it was a sphere, and stationary. after about a minute, not much more, it moves slowly to my left, not far, perhaps one times its diameter, towards the mountain peak, and down. then it fades away to nothing, in place.

i did not have camera or binoculars with me. no other witnesses. subsequent glances out my window at the mountain do not show anything like this, as they never did. i have also actually seen one weather balloon in my time here -- much smaller, a different shape entirely, closer, and in a different direction. military aircraft and helicopters pass over my house frequently, perhaps because we are near laveta pass on a line between los alamos and pueblo/colorado springs.

personal reaction: slow and puzzled. nothing dramatic in this event, but it occurs to me that reporting it might corroborate someone else's sighting. i would be happy, but surprised, to hear there is a perfectly ordinary explanation for what i saw.
content.summary: Large sun-reflecting metallic sphere, stationary slightly above mountain, disappears

content.detailedDescription: Whilst taking out a vaccuum bag to empty it, i came to notice a vry bright orange "star" in the sky. i thought of it as polaris (the northern star) and disregarded it. soon, however, it came to my attention that the light was not in the north direction but instead, it was southeast. checking a compass, i confirmed my suspecion. what struck me as odd though, was the fact that i had observed a similar object previously in virginia while on vacation. i went and got my dad. we are both ufo enthusiasts and watch programs on tv whenever we can. he took a look at it and (as i did) disregarded it. until, that is, it began moving. first, it moved right (eastward) and then began descending. quickly, my father, my little sister, and i jumped into our truck and took off, chasing the object. we soon came to a position where we could get a clear view. we had a cheap meade telescope with us and set it up on the truck. the object continued it's descent and we frantically sifted through lenses, finally finding on with the correct zoom, etc. as i looked through the lense, i saw that the object had three distinct colors to it (this may, however, be due to the lense), the colors being, red, white, and green. again, the object moved down. we jumped back in the truck and followed the light to the intersection of hereford farm and columbia road. we followed where we thought it would be but could not locate it. just as we were leaving (and on the phone with mufon) two helicopters (very close together) flew over us to where we orignally spotted the craft. one went on to fort gordon and the other made multiple passes over the area. during the initial experience, i was stunned and amazed. you never know when you will see something like that. when the helicoptors flew over, however, i got a conformation of my feelings. they seemed to be scanning, searching.
content.summary: Stationary orange bright object

content.detailedDescription:
In my living room i have a picture window that faces north where i can see a fair bit of the sky to the north of pekin, il above north pekin, creve coeur and east peoria. i'm used to seeing planes/helicopters and kind of keep an eye out for them. the peoria airport is 10mi or so to the northwest and lifeflight is active in the area.

what i seen last night is foreign to me. i can not explain this event. i don't necessarily think it has to be alien in nature, it could very well be some man made event. however, i do keep an open mind and it's a certainty that we're not alone in the universe. i am 36 years old, married, and father of twin 4 year old boys. i do not use drugs or drink alcohol. i was an infantry soldier in the illinois national guard from 1990-1992.

at about 8:40pm (+- 2 mins) on 18 september 2010 i had the lights off in the living room while i was watching some tv and eating a snack. out of the corner of my eye i caught a light in the sky and focused my attention on it. it was orange and not something i'm used to seeing.

i walked outside to have a better look. there was some cloud cover and i didn't see any stars. during the daylight hours we had been under a uniformly covered grey sky. i am assuming the night was more of the same. a couple hours after this event it was a little foggy and rainy.

the light itself was orange with some gold to it. it was flickering a bit and it appeared to me that the flickering was either caused by the various density of cloud cover between it and me or it was simply on fire. it was bright enough to see it through the clouds, but it did not brighten them or cast a glow around it. it was about as bright as venus. it moved in a straight line and didn't seem to deviate in it's motion or speed. it didn't instantly extinguish itself, it took about 10 seconds for it to disappear once it started to fade.

the time i first noticed the light to when it faded out was about 2 minutes. it travelled from the east to the west and i would estimate from my vantage point it was at 315deg when i first seen it and 10deg when it faded. due north being 0deg. elevation was approximately 50-55deg

i'm using the word faded, but i'm not sure if the object actually faded or if the cloud cover got thick enough to block it out. i kept looking for a couple of minutes to see if it would reappear. it did not. i spent enough time outside to completely smoke a cigarette.

there was no sound that i could hear from the object.

i checked the satellite flyby database and didn't see anything matching the location. i have not contacted the airport or any other officials. i noticed some other reports of a light loosely matching my description here in illinois in the past. could this be part of an ongoing event? 

please feel free to email me if you have or need any additional information. i will assist with anything i can. thanks!
content.summary: Slow moving orange/gold fireball or light from east to west

content.detailedDescription: While photographing a vintage car race at pacific raceways near auburn washington, i heard an airliner climbing after take off from the seattle airport.  i looked up to locate the airliner and decided to take a picture of it.  while taking the photo of the airliner, i noticed a bright spot in the sky.  after taking the airliner photo, i tried to find the bright spot.  it was gone.  i kept looking and saw it reappear.  aimed the camera at the spot and took a picture.  the spot did not appear to be moving.  was going to take a second picture but the spot was gone and did not reappear.  i thought it was a wayward helium balloon of some sort.  the strange thing was once i tried to take another photo of the race, the camera's autofocus no longer worked.  i had to turn off the camera and remove/reattach the lens to get things working again. once i got home and downloaded the photos, i checked this image closely and decided it did not look like a helium balloon.  my camera is a professional level canon with a high quality telephoto lens.  canon 1dmkii with a 70-200 2.8 telephoto and a 2x extender giving a total of 400mm.  i have the series of photos showing the airliner, the bright object and the empty sky plus one where the focus failed.
content.summary: Observed bright spot in clear sky

content.detailedDescription: Supplement to previous report.
content.summary: Supplement to previous report

content.detailedDescription:
It's back again. tonight just like all the other times (4 times) i have had the pleasure of witnessing this phenomenon, in the harbor city area of los angeles. its appears high up, (6,000-10,000ft), always slow moving (5-10mph), and frequently just hangs there in the sky, stationary. eventually drifts off on it's merry old way somewhere else.
tonights sighting was special because it emitted a strobe effect that lasted for about 10 seconds. it did this twice, and i have to say that effect was spectacular. wow.
about 12 weeks ago, after watching it meander for about 20 minutes, there was another different happening. as it hung there in the sky, another one of it's friends faded in (from outer space?)maybe to say hello. after a minute they both faded away, maybe they decided to share a tea break together!
i just find it hard to accept the us military or any other military for that matter, would allow for any of its officers to to fly or control anything, wasting so much public funds on such stupid innane behaviour. 
anyway, given the amount of sightings from the us and europe. anyway, it seems these orange orbs don't recognize international boundaries. 
it just doesn't make any sense.
can't wait to see the next show!
content.summary: Orange colored sphere(star like) object emits spectacular strobe lighting

content.detailedDescription: These pictures were taken with a stationary deer cam. notice the distance of the light from a duration of about a minute. the camera is installed about 6 ft off the ground. the other picture is the background during the daylight. i do not know what it is. i do not suspect that any person was there because of the wild animals.
content.summary: These pictures were taken with a deer cam.

content.detailedDescription: Shinny and bright 2 other people saw it to not together. weird sighting didnt move like a chooper or plane was driving and pulled over
content.summary: Silver shinny and moved and came back real fast

content.detailedDescription: I am 49 years old and sense i was  8 or 9 i have seen things. every time i have seen something in the sky it has always been very close. always about a 100 yards or closer. this has been going on all my life i wished  it never happened ever i mean ever. what i have seen lately is a boomerang shape allways at night. i have hade many more things happen but i wont write them down for just anyone to read. i will talk to someone but only in private. please if you can give me any insight it would give me peace of mind god knows i could use some. i dont wish for the world to know my personal busness. but i need to tell my story to someone. if not i will continue to keep all this to myself. like i have done my whole life. what i saw over my house has happen before. it is allways quite and very large. about 500 hundred feet wide and allmost clear with very slow moving and just go away very fast. i would love to tell someone about my childhood experances but only in a private setting. i dont care if anyone belives me or not i know it is all true. i dont want to be made a joke of so belive it or not i dont care. i know it is real and i know it it will contiue to happen to me. i know why so many people keep this kind of storys to themselfs. i dont know why i tell this story now but such is life. i guess
content.summary: Saw in sky

content.detailedDescription: I was talking on the phone in my back yard and saw something strange rising in the sky to the south. i ran to get some binoculars. i found the object and concluded quickly that it was a string of about six balloons. while looking at the balloons though, another object or two crossed within view. it was two large dim lights moving fairly quickly in tandem to the north. when i took the binoculars from my eyes i couldn't see the lights. i couldn't see any other form holding the lights together. they stayed in a fixed pattern and i thought they must be connected by a craft that was not visible in the current lighting conditions. the sky was still somewhat light but changing to night. dusk. i followed the two lights with the binoculars for about 15 seconds and it faded from view in the atmosphere. these lights were uniform in brightness and did not blink or strobe. if these balloons were 1/2 mile away looking through the binoculars these lights individually were perhaps ten times larger than a single balloon in comparison. i didn't see the lights pass behind the balloons but my feeling is that they were much higher. the distance between the lights compared to the length of the balloon string was about five times longer than the six balloons tied in a line.
content.summary: Sighted two large dim lights in tandem travelling north overhead

content.detailedDescription:
The other night a friend and i were driving back to his place at approx. 2:30am. 

he points our what he says is a ufo to me and i tell him from my point of view it looks like a plane, with the normal blinking light on the wing.

however, when we pull up to a red light around 30 seconds later the object (which now i will refer to a ufo) was much closer and at a lower altitude than just moments before. not only that but there were 2 lights blinking now one white and the other red (red light was on the right side, white was on the left). 

the ufo was just hovering silently and seemed to be a fairly large size although it was pitch dark and my only perception of it's size determined by the distance of the blinking lights. i was able to make our it was concave on the sides making it a rounded object when the lights would blink, to give an approximate size i'd say maybe 50-75ft across (although as i said it was hard since it was dark). the ufo did not hover the entire time we were at the red light, at one point it darted from left to right quickly then was stationary again - i know there is no 'publicly' known aircraft that can do this so i will remain calling this a ufo until i am told otherwise. 

that was just the beginning of the night however... 

after we got back to his place we were outside having a cigarette when i saw a light through the treeline that was moving. the light was a somewhat dull yellow however it was large in the shape of a rounded rectangle and bright enough you could see it was circular on either side (as in it was definitely 3 dimensional and not a stationary light facing us). this ufo was so low it was literally just above the treeline farther out - unfortunately the treeline by his house is so thick i only got a full view of it for about 30 seconds until it started moving slowly in the northwest direction. i kept seeing the ufo partly as it moved left nw - eventually it disappeared from our view (this happened quickly, not enough time to grab a camera or anything unfortunately although i really wish i had some footage because it was an amazing experience).

so, to sum this up, the first ufo had 2 blinking lights was stationary at first then darted west then back eastward very quickly - almost like it jumped/teleported.

the second ufo which was seen later on in that early morning (approx. time 4-5am, was before the sun rise), had what looked like a dim yellow 'bar' like light in the front but it was bright enough to reveal it was curved on the sides (i couldn't make out the entire shape but i know it was curved on both sides) - this second ufo moved silently through the tree line at an exact speed very low to the ground.

i decided to share this because i posted it on a forum and got responses saying others saw ufo's that same night/morning in pa and other east coast states.

i apologize for not having any pictures or video but i honestly didn't expect to be seeing anything nor did i have time to get a camera even if i wanted too.

i will keep an eye out with a camera for now on when i'm planning on being outside for a bit.
content.summary: It was rectangular in the front and seemed to be sphere like when the lites were on

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were sitting out in our backyard stargazing at 11pm tonight. i looked up and saw the 3 lights high in the sky above our home...I alerted my husband and he caught sight of it as well. we know it was not an airplane or military jet as we live on the mccarran flight path and are familiar with planes. this object was much higher in the sky than jets or commercial planes could travel. the object was triangular in shape with 3 lights. the lights were a faint white-light yellowish tinge color. the object literally glided across the sky, completely silent, for approximately 20 seconds. the space between the 3 lights was open, to where i could see the stars in between the lights as they moved. it was almost as if the 3 lights were independent of eachother but formed a triangle. i watched it the entire 20 seconds and it seemed to slowly fade away the farther it got. my husband ran inside to get our camera, but by the time he got back the object was gone. 
first time we've seen anything like this and we stargaze alot. seen a ton of satellites. this was definitely something i can't explain.
content.summary: Gliding triangular shape

content.detailedDescription: I was standing in the parking lot at the law enforcement complex in anson county, and i had just finished up processing an arrest that i had made.  a group of my colleagues and i were standing around talking and i looked up at the sky because it was an unusually clear and starry night.  when i looked up, i was looking southeast toward richmond county and i saw a bright light which looked like a star moving east across the sky.  i remember focusing in on the object and tried to see if i could see any blinking lights which would indicate that it was a plane and i could not notice any.  then, to the west of the object, i saw another light moving north.  i did notice lights blinking on it, and they appeared to be strobing like an airplane.  i then looked back at the first object and it was still moving east at a steady pace.  suddenly, the object began to speed up from its steady pace and suddenly went black and disappeared, still heading east.  the object was extremely bright, just like a planet would look, and remained that way until it just suddenly went black and disappeared.  when i say it disappeared, i mean that literally.  there was no gradual fading or cloud, it just went from bright to black instantly.  none of my colleagues observed it to my knowledge and i didn't even make mention of it at the time.  even though i thought it was odd that it just went black instantly, i didn't feel it necessary to bring it up to my colleagues.  this is partly because i had seen on the internet the day before that an asteroid was going to be moving close to the earth soon, and i couldn't remember if it stated that it would be viewable on this night, so i just dismissed it as the asteroid.  i was confident that it wasn't an airplane, because prior to becoming a law enforcement officer, i worked with aircraft in the navy, and i am very familiar with the flight operations and makeup of aircraft, both civilian and military.  however, i didn't actually think it was anything "out of this world" until the next day when i seen the local newspaper in richmond county, "the daily journal", which had an article about numerous ufo sightings occurring in hamlet, nc, the same night as my sighting.  hamlet is a small town in southeastern richmond county, and based on where i was looking in the sky, the object i seen would have been over that area of richmond county (anson county is the neighboring county to richmond county).  what was even more astonishing to me was the fact that the sightings reported occurred around the same time that i experienced my sighting.  according to the article, one witness seen a craft hovering over her neighbors house, others across town reported seeing the same type craft, while others on the other side of the city also observed objects.  a store clerk stated several of her customers came into the store reporting seeing an object similar to what the witness seen hovering over her neighbors house.  since monday i have spoken to several credible people who have told me that they also seen strange lights and crafts that night.  some say they seen the same "starry" type craft that i seen, while others seen a cylinder shaped object.  i'm a "no bull" kind of person, and because of my profession, i form my opinions based on what the evidence tells me.  just my sighting alone and i would have never thought twice about it, and i would have dismissed it altogether.  however, with all of the sightings reported by several different people in different parts of the area, it is hard to deny that we may have experienced a true ufo phenomenon in our little part of the world that night.  if you guys at mufon read this article, i think you truly have a good investigation in your hands down here.  the thing that gets me the most is that so many people witnessed something that night.  people from all walks of life, from all over the area seen similar objects.  for more information on the sightings and the article in the local paper go to [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]
content.summary: Saw bright light moving across sky over richmond county, several sightings reported that night.

content.detailedDescription:
Driving down pch from sunset beach towards huntington beach after a nice dinner.  suddenly my teenage daughter pointed out a flying object which we had seen last week too coming from the ocean side above the back bay in newport beach going inland, this time we saw a similar object also coming from the ocean side:  on the bottom rectangular shaped with white lights on the bottom, which roll sometimes from one side to another, some of them blinking on and off, almost like a thin flying carpet (to describe the shape) with a red light towards the back and maybe towards the top.  could not see the shape in the dark.  blinking lights on top sometimes.  it was flying above the water then changed direction, flew inland, moved to its side sometimes and then it flew north until we could see it no longer.
we were amazed to see this object again one week later.  then headed home until to our surprise we saw another one about 3 minutes later, also coming from the ocean side south of huntington beach (it was probably above the back bay again, pretty far to see from where we were) and going inland and then it disappeared.  the speed of these flying objects seem to change too.
is there something like this that we know of?  it was definitely not a plane, a blimp (which goes slowlier) or a helicopter.  who knows what it was?  we drive often in the evenings but have never seen anything like this.

sounds like these objects seen by others:  

[links moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]

i was driving and had no camera with me, too bad.
content.summary: 2 rectangular flying objects with red light towards back/top

content.detailedDescription:
@ 9:50pm i took my two dogs outside for the last time for the night. as i was standing there facing west, i clearly saw 3 red lights in the form of a triangle moving towards the northeast. it is extremely clear out at this time. my initial thought was "wow they are back." i sprinted inside and looked at the clock to confirm the sighting time. 9:56pm.  i literally jumped out of my shoes and scared the hell out of my wife who was brushing her teeth.
 
after a few moments, maybe 60-70 seconds, she found the video camera and i raced back out side, her following as she had seen them the halloween night as well.
 
much to my dissapointment, the lights were no place to be found. my wife gave up looking after a few minutes and said call her if i see them again.
 
standing outside, i noted the conditions. what stood out right away to me was the complete lack of air traffic in my area. there are always planes somewhere to be seen in the sky. nothing. not a sound. after about 10 mins i gave up but i did notice that as i was coming in, planes began to appear again. it stood out because it was so odd to me.
 
night was crisp (65deg) and skies were clear with a light haze to the west. i believe mars was in the western sky low on the horizon. but the lights i saw were clearly much closer and could no way be interpreted as being a part of what i saw.
content.summary: Three red lights in western sky tinley park il

content.detailedDescription: I stepped outside tonight and noticed the brightness of the the moon.  to the left of the moon (which would be to the east)there was a bright "star".  it wasn't blinking but emitting a steady bright light like most stars do.  at first i thought my eyes were playing tricks on me because the star seemed to be moving very slowly in a southern direction.  as i watched it i realized it was moving but too slowly for a satellite.  i stepped to the door and asked my wife to come out to see it.  she saw it and also said it was moving very slowly.  a band of clouds were coming from the south at which time the star disappeared behind them.  we watched for about 10 minutes as the clouds moved away but the "star" had disappeared.
content.summary: Star-like object moving very slowly to the south

content.detailedDescription: It was above my home in the sky a white ufo orb.
content.summary: It was a white orb circle ufo uso.

content.detailedDescription: Went to pick up my son visiting friends in a neighboring town about 8pm. stopped at grocery store to pick up eggs. turned corner from turnpike rd, rte 75, windsor locks, onto north street. as we approached our turn on to acorn drive to go home, i noticed 3 star-like entities in a grouping,each moving slightly.  you could tell they were not stars or planets since they were too close to the earth and were of a different color -- a sort of dusky, dull yellowish-orange. we pulled into north street school parking lot to watch them instead of gong home.  the show was very short-lived.  i would say each "light" disappeared within 30-45 seconds of the others so that the whole thing lasted about a minut and a half.  there were a man and a woman at the school playground that saw it, too, but they reported having seen 4 lights so we must have noticed them after one (or more) had already disappeared. my son, nick, was witness to this also.
content.summary: Three dullish yellow star-like grouping flickering then 1by1 disappearing

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting in the parking lot of target and out of the corner of my eye across the tops of some trees i saw all there bright lights. i looked closer and there were 7 lights around a triangle shaped flying object. this was not my first time seeing something like this, but i was so surprised! 

it started to bank away from me and thats the point at which i could see the formation of lights on the bottom of it. this aircraft looked very big. it was about 3 times the size of a stealth bomber. and the lights were totally different than those of a stealth bomber 

at first sighting, i though this was just an ordinary aircraft. but upon further examination, it was clear that this was not an ordinary aircraft. 

i finally lost sight of the object when it got behind the tree line
content.summary: 7 white lights forming a triangle under a triangle shaped ufo

content.detailedDescription: We were let off work around 6pm et. i dropped off 2 coworkers and headed west on columbia ave toward fort custer air base. i noticed directly above fcab 2 jets circling around what appeared to me to be an orange cloud. it wasnt strange until i got by exit 92 on i-94 going towards kalamazoo, mi that i noticed this cylindrical cloud was now south of the air base just south of i-94 and now it appears to be almost doughnut shaped with what appeared to be a dark center to the object. this anomoly was huge and went from a southward direction to a westward direction in a matter of seconds. by the time i had reached exit 85 in galeburg, mi this "cloud" had already passed kalamaoo by my estimation and seemed to be following i-94 towards chicago. i arrived at work the very next day and begun to tell my story to a few co-workers when my manager stepped in and admitted she had witnessed the same thing at exit 92 in battle creek and she had called her mother by cell and her mother had also seen the object from exit 100 in battle creek, mi. only differnce was they did not see the jets that i seen circling the object minutes before. i have never seen such an object in the sky as large as this. i had no fear of the object whatsoever, the object to me appeared to not be perfectly round either. i have looked and looked at multiple supposed pictures and video of ufo sightings and the only object i have found close to resembling this object was a youtube video i seen of what is called the "haarp" program. my co-worker and her mother believe they seen muliple colors, what i seen was a violent orange and made the fcab jets look like pin points in the sky. i believe the jets were a-10's, not 100% sure on that. whatever this "cloud" was caught not only my attention, but also the attention of a co-worker, her mother and i know for a fact 2 pilots at fcab!
content.summary: Short day at work noticed 2 jets circling what first appeared to be orange cloud headed southward then turning 90 degrees westbound.

content.detailedDescription:
This happened about 25 -27 years ago.  i think the year was 1983 but it could have been 1984 - 1985.  it was in the evening in the summer in doylestown, pa.  i went outside and in the sky in my neighborhood there were 4-6 orange objects in the sky.  i can't remember if they were diamond or triangle.  

these objects were not crafts.  i would describle them as lights.

they were stationary for awhile but then moved around in the same spot.  my parents and brother witnessed these orange objects too but none of us can remember the details.  i would have been 11 - 13 years old.  i was afraid so my dad had us all go inside.  i don't know how long the objects were there or how they disappaered.

other people in the area reported these objects and the newspaper wrote an article stating they were weather balons. nobody seemed to buy it.  this started my life long fear of ufo's.  

i have reported other sightings to mufon (all in il)but just decided to report this one because i see that other people have reported things from many years ago.  i guess the more people report the better!
content.summary: 4-6 orange stationary objects seen in doylestown, pa in july 1983.

content.detailedDescription:
On sept. 15th at approximately 11pm i pulled into my driveway.  i noticed a golden yellow ovalish circle in the sky.  something looked off to me.  half of the circle was dark-- like a line was divided right down the middle.  it looked too low and a little oval to me, but i decided it was the moon.  i went into the house and a few minutes later i noticed the "moon" was in a different place.  i ran to get my mother. when i went outside to look at it it had turned into an orange flash and was moving very fast.  by the time my mother came outside she could only see an orange light / flash thru the trees.  then the object disappeared.  

this object was initially in about the same place (except) much closer to me as the ufo i reported to mufon in feb. of 2009.
content.summary: Golden - yellow moon - like ball turns into an orange flash in caseyville, il

content.detailedDescription:
I was on my way home, on milburn school house road in caseyville, il when i saw a huge reddish orange fireball like object in the sky.  i saw it 2 nights in a row at about the same exact time each night.  i was only about 3 minutes away from my house and was driving alone. there was one car on the road ahead of me.  scott airforce base is about 25 minutes away.
i just went home.  i did not pull over on the side of the road or drive closer to the object.  i am not sure what 2 nights i saw the ball in the sky but it had to be between august 20 - 27th.  both times it was around 10:30pm - 11pm.  


i have previously reported 2 other ufo sightings to mufon over the past couple years in this same exact area.  there are 3 more sightings i have not reported but will do so after i submit this report. this is the same area the famous 2000 ufo was chased by 4 or 5 police cars.    

my first thought was the giant ball was a ufo but then i decided it must be something on a building or tower.  the next night i saw the very same thing.  

on sept 15th i saw another ball in the sky so i checked out your sight and nufroc and see that there have been several sightings of these balls around the country as well as my area which is 15 minutes from st. louis.  i guess some people reported seeing these balls on the 4th of july in the st. louis area.  


you can contact me but please keep my name, address and phone number off of your sight and the internet.
content.summary: Reddish orange ball in sky seen in caseyville, il

content.detailedDescription:
Day two of spotting a ufo near stockdale, texas  we (myself , my son and his younger step-brother and step-sister) parked our suv approximately 2.5 miles (texas 87/97 and county road 538) southwest of where we spotted the three lighted triangle ufo the night before. we set up four cameras (one vhs-c and three digitals) around the suv. at exactly 9:03pm we spotted what we believe to be the same triangle ufo as the night before. it was moving at the exact airspeed and flight path angel (from the northwest to southeast) as the night before. however this time, the altitude was up to about 8,000 feet and it tracked about a 40 degree angle up from the horizon west from our location and the flight path was about 15 miles west from the night before. 

my experience as a retired army helicopter mechanic and weapons tech makes me feel that this is a drone. when my son said the ufo was zigzagging coming down from the sky the night before reminded me how the old line-of-sight, wire guided tow missiles would zigzag along its sighted path to its target. this ufo looks and feels like it is on a pre-calculated flight path using the earth magnetic fields as way-points and not land terrain or land marks as flight references.  it also reminds me of how we would send spaceship or probes to other planets to map the terrain. in other word, it is either mapping the terrain or it is looking for any wreckage from the reported falling airliner, see mufon report wingless, burning object falls from cloud near la vernia, texas. 

now here is the kicker, as soon as we spotted the ufo, two of the digital cameras locked up (froze).  i never see the cameras do this before. the vhc-s camera could not get a focus on it but we have audio. the jvc 1080 camera was the only one that worked but the quality it terrible (see added film).  i cannot say what caused the three cameras to go bad but this morning they are working just fine now.

i cannot make it back out there tonight for i have to work this weekend. it would be nice if someone could continue the watch tonight. looking over the maps i predict if should track just southwest of floresville, texas anywhere between 8:30 and 9:30pm. maybe setup at 97 and cr 102 but this is just a guess, it could pop about anywhere or nowhere.
content.summary: Second day seeing triangle ufo near stockdale, texas.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife & i were going to bed and she is always in front of me walking down the hall, i stopped at a window and looked out and seen this huge air ship with a string of lights( not flashing) and flying very low, i holler at my wife, come here! when she got back to the window with the first one still in view, here came another one in the exact same path. they had no sound and were moving very slow and low and they turned slighty left, heading southwest and our vision was soon cut off, due to trees. i am not sure about the exact year this happen, but i am within a few years. it was at bed time and dark. there were more things happen after that( few years later) but i don't have time to write all this down. 
*(wit's name deleted -- sgonzalez/cms)
content.summary: My wife & i were retiring to bed when i looked out the window and seen one large object (flying low), following was another one. no sound.

content.detailedDescription:
It was about to rain last night so i decided to sit out on my balcony and read my book, enjoying the evening.  the clouds looked pretty dark and ominous, so i took a closer look.  this was just after 6 pm, maybe 6:15.  i saw, then, under the cloud cover a dark object.  i was startled, but tried to think as logically as i could.  it appeared to be spherical in shape, but it was quite far away.  i would say it was about the size of a pencil eraser if i was to hold that up to the sky.  it was either black, or dark grey.  as i watched i could see that it was rotating around a central axis.  i know it wasn't a bird because it wasn't moving, at least not flying across the sky.  it wasn't an airplane or a helicopter because there were no lights.  it did move slowly through the sky....By the time i lost sight of it, it had moved from the north-east to the north-west.  but it took about 10 minutes for it to move that far.  i lost sight of it when i went inside, down the stairs, and out the front door to get a better look.  i couldn't find it again.

i did call my daughter out to see it, and she saw it as well.  we both had feelings of awe and excitement.  the only think i could think of that it might have been would be a balloon, but then again i don't think that is how a balloon would move, especially underneath the storm clouds.
content.summary: I saw a dark sphere shape underneath the cloudcover. as i watched i noticed it wasn't moving around, but was rotating.

content.detailedDescription: I was wacthing the news and then looked outside and out of the blue two lights appeared . the lights colors where white  and blue and flashing. the  abullet shape appeeared and then dissepeard
content.summary: Flashing blue and white lights bulky
